title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: minter package provides tools calculating effect sizes used meta-analyses, specialized support factorial experimental designs repeated measures studies. package offers consistent interface computing various effect size metrics.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: minter implements two primary categories effect size calculations:

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: experimental designs two factors (2×2 designs), supporting three types comparisons: Individual/Simple effects: Direct comparisons single treatments Main effects: Average effect one factor across levels another factor Interaction effects: effect one factor depends level another factor

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: longitudinal studies examining treatment × time interactions -time-series designs.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: SMD_ind - Individual/simple effect SMD_main - Main effect SMD_inter - Interaction effect

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: lnRR_ind - Individual/simple effect lnRR_main - Main effect lnRR_inter - Interaction effect

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: lnVR_ind - Individual/simple effect lnVR_main - Main effect lnVR_inter - Interaction effect

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: lnCVR_ind - Individual/simple effect lnCVR_main - Main effect lnCVR_inter - Interaction effect

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: time_SMD - Treatment × time interaction (SMD) time_lnRR - Treatment × time interaction (lnRR) time_lnVR - Treatment × time interaction (lnVR) time_lnCVR - Treatment × time interaction (lnCVR)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: functions compute effect sizes standard 2×2 factorial designs two factors (B) manipulated, creating four treatment groups: Control, alone, B alone, AB combined.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Effect sizes factorial meta-analysis first introduced Gurevitch et al. (2000), presented methods estimating main interaction effects analogous factorial ANOVA. Originally developed Standardized Mean Difference, approaches extended effect size families including response ratios variability measures. Recent developments Shinichi Nakagawa Daniel Noble expanded methods include lnVR lnCVR effect sizes, providing researchers comprehensive tools meta-analyzing factorial experiments.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: thank Shinichi Nakagawa Daniel Noble theoretical contributions factorial meta-analysis methodology generously sharing unpublished formulas.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Standardized Mean Difference measures magnitude treatment effects standard deviation units, making comparable across studies different measurement scales.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes individual simple effect Factor compared Control. equivalent classic SMD can computed using metafor’s escalc() function measure = "SMD". Formula: dind=X‾−X‾CtrlSpooled⋅J(m)d_{ind} = \frac{\bar{X}_A - \bar{X}_{Ctrl}}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) pooled standard deviation : Spooled=(nA−1)sdA2+(nCtrl−1)sdCtrl2nA+nCtrl−2S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{(n_A-1)sd_A^2 + (n_{Ctrl}-1)sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_A + n_{Ctrl} - 2}} Small-sample bias correction: J(m)J(m) correction (Hedges correction) applied default can disabled: J(m)=1−34m−1J(m) = 1 - \frac{3}{4m-1} m=nA+nCtrl−2m = n_A + n_{Ctrl} - 2 Sampling variance: var(dind)=1nA+1nCtrl+d22(nA+nCtrl)var(d_{ind}) = \frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d^2}{2(n_A + n_{Ctrl})}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes main effect Factor averaged across levels Factor B, analogous main effects factorial ANOVA. Formula: dmain=(X‾+X‾AB)−(X‾B+X‾Ctrl)2Spooled⋅J(m)d_{main} = \frac{(\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}) - (\bar{X}_{B} + \bar{X}_{Ctrl})}{2S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) Pooled standard deviation (four groups): Spooled=(nA−1)sdA2+(nB−1)sdB2+(nAB−1)sdAB2+(nCtrl−1)sdCtrl2nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl−4S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{(n_A-1)sd_A^2 + (n_B-1)sd_B^2 + (n_{AB}-1)sd_{AB}^2 + (n_{Ctrl}-1)sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl} - 4}} Degrees freedom: m=nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl−4m = n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl} - 4 Sampling variance: var(dmain)=14(1nA+1nB+1nAB+1nCtrl+dmain22(nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl))var(d_{main}) = \frac{1}{4} \left(\frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_B} + \frac{1}{n_{AB}} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d_{main}^2}{2(n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl})}\right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes interaction factors B, measuring effect depends level B. Formula: dinter=(X‾AB−X‾B)−(X‾−X‾Ctrl)Spooled⋅J(m)d_{inter} = \frac{(\bar{X}_{AB} - \bar{X}_B) - (\bar{X}_A - \bar{X}_{Ctrl})}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J(m) Uses four-group pooled standard deviation main effect. Sampling variance: var(dinter)=1nA+1nB+1nAB+1nCtrl+dinter22(nA+nB+nAB+nCtrl)var(d_{inter}) = \frac{1}{n_A} + \frac{1}{n_B} + \frac{1}{n_{AB}} + \frac{1}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d_{inter}^2}{2(n_A + n_B + n_{AB} + n_{Ctrl})}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Log Response Ratio measures proportional changes treatments, providing intuitive interpretation.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRind=ln(X‾AX‾Ctrl)\ln RR_{ind} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRind)=sdA2nAX‾A2+sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2var(\ln RR_{ind}) = \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRmain=ln(X‾+X‾ABX‾Ctrl+X‾B)\ln RR_{main} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl} + \bar{X}_B}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRmain)=(1X‾+X‾AB)2(sdA2nA+sdAB2nAB)+(1X‾Ctrl+X‾B)2(sdCtrl2nCtrl+sdB2nB)var(\ln RR_{main}) = \left(\frac{1}{\bar{X}_A + \bar{X}_{AB}}\right)^2 \left(\frac{sd_A^2}{n_A} + \frac{sd_{AB}^2}{n_{AB}}\right) + \left(\frac{1}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl} + \bar{X}_B}\right)^2 \left(\frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{sd_B^2}{n_B}\right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRRinter=ln(X‾ABX‾B)−ln(X‾AX‾Ctrl)\ln RR_{inter} = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_{AB}}{\bar{X}_B}\right) - \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_A}{\bar{X}_{Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRRinter)=sdAB2nABX‾AB2+sdA2nAX‾A2+sdB2nBX‾B2+sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2var(\ln RR_{inter}) = \frac{sd_{AB}^2}{n_{AB}\bar{X}_{AB}^2} + \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{sd_B^2}{n_B\bar{X}_B^2} + \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Log Variation Ratio compares variability treatments, providing insights treatments affect response consistency.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRind=ln(sdAsdCtrl)+12(nA−1)−12(nCtrl−1)\ln VR_{ind} = \ln\left(\frac{sd_{}}{sd_{Ctrl}}\right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnVRind)=12(nA−1)+12(nCtrl−1)var(\ln VR_{ind}) = \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRmain=12ln(sdAB⋅sdAsdB⋅sdCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln VR_{main} = \frac{1}{2} \ln\left( \frac{sd_{AB} \cdot sd_{}}{sd_{B} \cdot sd_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnVRmain)=14(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1))var(\ln VR_{main}) = \frac{1}{4} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVRinter=ln(sdAB/sdBsdA/sdCtrl)+12(nAB−1)−12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1)\ln VR_{inter} = \ln\left( \frac{sd_{AB} / sd_{B}}{sd_{} / sd_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnVRinter)=12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)+12(nCtrl−1)var(\ln VR_{inter}) = \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Log Coefficient Variation Ratio combines information mean responses variability comparing coefficients variation (CV=sd/x‾CV = sd / \bar{x}).

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRind=ln(CVACVCtrl)+12(nA−1)−12(nCtrl−1)\ln CVR_{ind} = \ln\left( \frac{CV_{}}{CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} Sampling variance: var(lnCVRind)=sdCtrl2nCtrlX‾Ctrl2+12(nCtrl−1)+sdA2nAX‾A2+12(nA−1)var(\ln CVR_{ind}) = \frac{sd_{Ctrl}^2}{n_{Ctrl}\bar{X}_{Ctrl}^2} + \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} + \frac{sd_A^2}{n_A\bar{X}_A^2} + \frac{1}{2(n_A - 1)} assumes correlation mean variance (Nakagawa et al. 2015) computed sum lnRR lnVR variances.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRmain=12ln(CVAB⋅CVACVB⋅CVCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)+12(nA−1)−12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln CVR_{main} = \frac{1}{2} \ln\left( \frac{CV_{AB} \cdot CV_{}}{CV_{B} \cdot CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVRmain)=var(lnRRmain)+var(lnVRmain)var(\ln CVR_{main}) = var(\ln RR_{main}) + var(\ln VR_{main}) follows assumption correlation mean variance.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVRinter=ln(CVAB/CVBCVA/CVCtrl)+12(12(nAB−1)−12(nA−1)+12(nB−1)−12(nCtrl−1))\ln CVR_{inter} = \ln\left( \frac{CV_{AB} / CV_{B}}{CV_{} / CV_{Ctrl}} \right) + \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{1}{2(n_{AB} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{} - 1)} + \frac{1}{2(n_{B} - 1)} - \frac{1}{2(n_{Ctrl} - 1)} \right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVRinter)=var(lnRRinter)+var(lnVRinter)var(\ln CVR_{inter}) = var(\ln RR_{inter}) + var(\ln VR_{inter}) follows assumption correlation mean variance.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: functions compute effect sizes treatment × time interactions longitudinal studies, comparing experimental control groups change time.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Computes standardized mean difference interaction experimental treatment time. Formula: d=((X‾t1,Exp−X‾t1,Ctrl)−(X‾t0,Exp−X‾t0,Ctrl))Spooled⋅Jd = \frac{((\bar{X}_{t1,Exp} - \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}) - (\bar{X}_{t0,Exp} - \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}))}{S_{pooled}} \cdot J Time-specific pooled standard deviation: Spooled=((nExp−1)(sdt0,Exp2+sdt1,Exp2)+(nCtrl−1)(sdt0,Ctrl2+sdt1,Ctrl2))2(nExp+nCtrl−2)S_{pooled} = \sqrt{\frac{((n_{Exp} - 1)(sd_{t0,Exp}^2 + sd_{t1,Exp}^2) + (n_{Ctrl} - 1)(sd_{t0,Ctrl}^2 + sd_{t1,Ctrl}^2))}{2(n_{Exp} + n_{Ctrl} - 2)}} Sampling variance: var(d)=2(1−rExp)nExp+2(1−rCtrl)nCtrl+d22(nExp+nCtrl)var(d) = \frac{2(1 - r_{Exp})}{n_{Exp}} + \frac{2(1 - r_{Ctrl})}{n_{Ctrl}} + \frac{d^2}{2(n_{Exp} + n_{Ctrl})} rExpr_{Exp} rCtrlr_{Ctrl} correlations time points within group.

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnRR=ln(X‾t1,Exp/X‾t1,CtrlX‾t0,Exp/X‾t0,Ctrl)\ln RR = \ln\left(\frac{\bar{X}_{t1,Exp} / \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}}{\bar{X}_{t0,Exp} / \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnRR)=(sdt0,Exp2X‾t1,Exp2+sdt1,Exp2X‾t0,Exp2−2rExpX‾t0,ExpX‾t1,Expsdt0,Expsdt1,Exp)nExpX‾t0,Exp2X‾t1,Exp2+var(\ln RR) = \frac{(sd_{t0,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Exp}^2 + sd_{t1,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t0,Exp}^2 - 2r_{Exp} \bar{X}_{t0,Exp} \bar{X}_{t1,Exp} sd_{t0,Exp} sd_{t1,Exp})}{n_{Exp} \bar{X}_{t0,Exp}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Exp}^2} +(sdt0,Ctrl2X‾t1,Ctrl2+sdt1,Ctrl2X‾t0,Ctrl2−2rCtrlX‾t0,CtrlX‾t1,Ctrlsdt0,Ctrlsdt1,Ctrl)nCtrlX‾t0,Ctrl2X‾t1,Ctrl2\frac{(sd_{t0,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}^2 + sd_{t1,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}^2 - 2r_{Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl} sd_{t0,Ctrl} sd_{t1,Ctrl})}{n_{Ctrl} \bar{X}_{t0,Ctrl}^2 \bar{X}_{t1,Ctrl}^2}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnVR=ln(sdt1,Exp/sdt1,Ctrlsdt0,Exp/sdt0,Ctrl)\ln VR = \ln\left(\frac{sd_{t1,Exp} / sd_{t1,Ctrl}}{sd_{t0,Exp} / sd_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnVR)=(1−rExp2)nExp−1+(1−rCtrl2)nCtrl−1var(\ln VR) = \frac{(1 - r_{Exp}^2)}{n_{Exp} - 1} + \frac{(1 - r_{Ctrl}^2)}{n_{Ctrl} - 1}

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Formula: lnCVR=ln(CVt1,Exp/CVt1,CtrlCVt0,Exp/CVt0,Ctrl)\ln CVR = \ln\left(\frac{CV_{t1,Exp} / CV_{t1,Ctrl}}{CV_{t0,Exp} / CV_{t0,Ctrl}}\right) Sampling variance: var(lnCVR)=var(lnRR)+var(lnVR)var(\ln CVR) = var(\ln RR) + var(\ln VR)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: functions share common parameters: data: Data frame containing variables col_names: Vector two strings naming output columns (default: c("yi", "vi")) append: Logical, whether append results input data (default: TRUE)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Group statistics: [Group]_mean, [Group]_sd, [Group]_n group (Ctrl, , B, AB) hedges_correction: Logical, apply small-sample bias correction (SMD , default: TRUE)

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Time-specific statistics: t0_[Group]_mean, t0_[Group]_sd, t1_[Group]_mean, t1_[Group]_sd Sample sizes: [Group]_n group Correlations: [Group]_cor - correlation time points within group

title: Effect Size Calculations with minter
text: Gurevitch, J., Morrison, J. ., & Hedges, L. V. (2000). interaction competition predation: meta-analysis field experiments. American Naturalist, 155(4), 435-453. Morris, W. F., Hufbauer, R. ., Agrawal, . ., Bever, J. D., Borowicz, V. ., Gilbert, G. S., … & Vázquez, D. P. (2007). Direct interactive effects enemies mutualists plant performance: meta‐analysis. Ecology, 88(4), 1021-1029. Nakagawa, S., Poulin, R., Mengersen, K., Reinhold, K., Engqvist, L., Lagisz, M., & Senior, . M. (2015). Meta‐analysis variation: ecological evolutionary applications beyond. Methods Ecology Evolution, 6(2), 143-152. Lajeunesse, M. J. (2011). meta‐analysis response ratios studies correlated multi‐group designs. Ecology, 92(11), 2049-2055. Personal communications: Shinichi Nakagawa Daniel Noble recent developments factorial effect size calculations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Facundo Decunta (2025). minter: Effect sizes Meta-analysis interactions. R package version 0.0.1. https://fdecunta.github.io/minter/
code: @Manual{,   title = {minter: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions},   author = {Facundo Decunta},   year = {2025},   url = {https://fdecunta.github.io/minter/}, }

what: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
text: Factorial designs help us understand synergies antagonisms ecological factors. However, meta-analyses factorial experiments rare ecology, likely extracting effect sizes factorial data straightforward. minter R package simplifies process providing functions extract different effect sizes factorial data, enabling researchers conduct meta-analyses interactions factors.

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
code: devtools::install_github("fdecunta/minter")

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
code: library(minter)  # Dummy data from 8 studies examining fertilization × drought on plant biomass studies <- data.frame(   study_id = 1:8,   # Control: No fertilization, well-watered   Ctrl_mean = c(12.3, 15.7, 10.8, 14.2, 11.9, 13.5, 16.1, 12.7),   Ctrl_sd   = c(2.1, 3.2, 1.8, 2.7, 2.3, 2.9, 3.5, 2.4),   Ctrl_n    = c(20, 24, 18, 22, 19, 25, 23, 21),   # Fertilization only   Fert_mean = c(18.5, 21.3, 16.2, 19.8, 17.1, 20.4, 22.7, 18.9),   Fert_sd   = c(3.1, 4.1, 2.7, 3.6, 3.2, 3.8, 4.2, 3.4),   Fert_n    = c(22, 25, 20, 24, 21, 26, 25, 23),   # Drought only     Drought_mean = c(8.7, 11.2, 7.9, 10.1, 8.3, 9.8, 11.7, 9.4),   Drought_sd   = c(1.8, 2.4, 1.6, 2.1, 1.9, 2.3, 2.6, 2.0),   Drought_n    = c(19, 23, 17, 21, 18, 24, 22, 20),   # Both treatments   Both_mean = c(14.2, 17.8, 12.9, 16.3, 13.7, 16.1, 18.4, 15.2),   Both_sd   = c(2.9, 3.7, 2.5, 3.3, 2.8, 3.4, 3.9, 3.1),   Both_n    = c(21, 26, 19, 23, 20, 27, 24, 22) )  # Calculate interaction effect: Does fertilization work differently under drought? interaction_results <- lnRR_inter(   data = studies,   Ctrl_mean = "Ctrl_mean", Ctrl_sd = "Ctrl_sd", Ctrl_n = "Ctrl_n",   A_mean = "Fert_mean", A_sd = "Fert_sd", A_n = "Fert_n",    B_mean = "Drought_mean", B_sd = "Drought_sd", B_n = "Drought_n",   AB_mean = "Both_mean", AB_sd = "Both_sd", AB_n = "Both_n" )  head(interaction_results) #>   study_id Ctrl_mean Ctrl_sd ... yi        vi #> 1        1      12.3     2.1     0.081  0.0069 #> 2        2      15.7     3.2     0.158  0.0068 #> 3        3      10.8     1.8     0.084  0.0073  # Meta-analysis library(metafor) res <- rma(yi, vi, ..., data = interaction_results)

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
text: lnRR: Log Response Ratio - proportional effects SMD: Standardized Mean Difference - standardized effects lnVR: Log Variability Ratio - effects variability lnCVR: Log Coefficient Variation Ratio - effects relative variability

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
text: Individual: Simple treatment vs. control Main: Overall effect across levels another factor Interaction: one factor’s effect depend another? Time: Treatment × time interactions repeated measures

title: Effect sizes for Meta-analysis of interactions
text: thank Shinichi Nakagawa Daniel Noble generously sharing unpublished formulas meta-analysis interactions, form theoretical foundation package.

title: Simple effect: Standardized Mean Difference — SMD_ind
text: Computes individual simple effect Factor Control.

title: Simple effect: Standardized Mean Difference — SMD_ind
code: SMD_ind(   data,   col_names = c("yi", "vi"),   append = TRUE,   hedges_correction = TRUE,   Ctrl_mean,   Ctrl_sd,   Ctrl_n,   A_mean,   A_sd,   A_n )

title: Simple effect: Standardized Mean Difference — SMD_ind
text: data Data frame containing variables used. col_names Vector two strings name output columns effect size sampling variance. Default 'yi' 'vi'. append Logical. Append results data. Default TRUE hedges_correction Boolean. TRUE correct small-sample bias. Default TRUE. Ctrl_mean Mean outcome Control treatment Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control treatment Ctrl_n Sample size control streatment A_mean Mean outcome experimental treatment A_sd Standard deviation experimental treatment A_n Sample size experimental treatment

title: Simple effect: Standardized Mean Difference — SMD_ind
text: classic Standardized Mean Difference (SMD), can also computed metafor's escalc() function using measure = "SMD". See package vignette detailed description formula.

Ecology, 88(4), 1021-1029. https://doi.org/10.1890/06-0442

Default TRUE hedges_correction Logical. Apply Hedges' correction small-sample bias. Default TRUE Ctrl_mean Mean outcome Control treatment Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control treatment Ctrl_n Sample size control streatment A_mean Mean outcome treatment A_sd Standard deviation treatment A_n Sample size treatment B_mean Mean outcome B treatment B_sd Standard deviation B treatment B_n Sample size B treatment AB_mean Mean outcome interaction AxB treatment AB_sd Standard deviation interaction AxB treatment AB_n Sample size interaction AxB treatment

Ctrl_mean Mean outcome Control treatment Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control treatment Ctrl_n Sample size control streatment A_mean Mean outcome treatment A_sd Standard deviation treatment A_n Sample size treatment B_mean Mean outcome B treatment B_sd Standard deviation B treatment B_n Sample size B treatment AB_mean Mean outcome interaction AxB treatment AB_sd Standard deviation interaction AxB treatment AB_n Sample size interaction AxB treatment

what: Fake factorial dataset with pre-computed effect sizes — testing_data
title: Fake factorial dataset with pre-computed effect sizes — testing_data
text: dataset contains fake data 2×2 factorial experiments four treatment groups: Control (C), Factor , Factor B, combination AB (B together). includes means, standard deviations, sample sizes group, well pre-computed effect sizes: log response ratio (lnRR), standardized mean difference (SMD), variances, main effects , B, interaction (AB).

title: Fake factorial dataset with pre-computed effect sizes — testing_data
code: testing_data

title: Fake factorial dataset with pre-computed effect sizes — testing_data
text: data frame 10 rows 24 columns: C_n, C_mean, C_sd Sample size, mean, SD Control group A_n, A_mean, A_sd Sample size, mean, SD treatment B_n, B_mean, B_sd Sample size, mean, SD B treatment AB_n, AB_mean, AB_sd Sample size, mean, SD AB (B combined) treatment A_main_lnRR, A_main_lnRRv Log response ratio main effect variance B_main_lnRR, B_main_lnRRv Log response ratio main effect B variance AB_main_lnRR, AB_main_lnRRv Log response ratio AB interaction variance A_main_SMD, A_main_SMDv Standardized mean difference (Hedges' g) main effect variance B_main_SMD, B_main_SMDv Standardized mean difference main effect B variance AB_main_SMD, AB_main_SMDv Standardized mean difference AB interaction variance

Default TRUE hedges_correction Logical. Apply Hedges' correction small-sample bias. Default TRUE. t0_Ctrl_mean Sample mean control group time 0 t0_Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control group time 0 t1_Ctrl_mean Sample mean control group time 1 t1_Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control group time 1 Ctrl_n Sample size control group Ctrl_cor Number numeric vector. Correlation means control group t0 t1 t0_Exp_mean Sample mean experimental group time 0 t0_Exp_sd Standard deviation experimental group time 0 t1_Exp_mean Sample mean experimental group time 1 t1_Exp_sd Standard deviation experimental group time 1 Exp_n Sample size experimental group Exp_cor Number numeric vector. Correlation means experimental group t0 t1
